title: Waistcoat, ca. 1795
medium: Technique: embroidery: satin, stem and knot stitches in 10 colors of silk, appliqué of polychrome plate-printed silk 4&1 satin medallions and silk    embroidered plain weave silk medallions, silk plain weave tape and silk and metallic twill tape, with seq
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Gentleman's waistcoat with embroidery and appliqué of printed medallions at bottom. The medallion below the left pocket is of Diana disarming Cupid, the one below the right pocket is of Venus playing with Cupid.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat, ca. 1795.
ca. 1795. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-52.
